problem.p: A physical pendulum consists of a disc of radius \(a\) and mass \(M\) fixed at the end of a rod of length \(d\) and negligible mass. The other end of the rod is pivoted about point Q as shown. Initially the bob is released from rest from a small angle \(\theta_o\) with respect to the vertical. At the bottom of the bobâ€™s trajectory, it collides with another disc of radius \(a\) and mass \(m\), \(M > m\), initially at rest. The lighter disc sticks to the larger one forming a new pendulum. (Note that the centre of the discs coincide).
What angle does the new pendulum rise to when it first comes to rest?
Part b: What is the frequency of oscillation of the pendulum before the collisions?
Part c: The angular frequency of oscillation of the new pendulum (after the collision) is:
1. larger than the one calculated in part b.
2. equal to the one calculated in part b.
3. smaller than the one calculated in part b.
